head.supplied: Swamps, 15 March, 1858. ¶ I am glad little Matthilde has 2 teeth, hope the little thing will soon bite more through. Only think our poor little Darling has not his through yet, he suffers much from th...

div.p: From Bertha Doughty to Clara Wehl
RB MSS M number, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

Transcribed 23 March 1989. Corrected 15 October.
Swamps, 15 March, 1858.

I am glad little Matthilde has 2 teeth, hope the little thing will soon bite more through. Only think our poor little Darling has not his through yet, he suffers much from them & since he was so ill four weeks ago he is not the same, never shouts now, but is so quiet & crys sometimes, what he never used to do, I feel very anxious about him. My dear George is here this week cattle mustering, it is so nice to have him here, he was so lonely last week by himself; he has had the house painted, to surprise me, but could not help telling me when he came. He will be another week here & then we intend to take Mrs. Montrey with us for a few weeks for a change for her.
16th. - Today little Georgie has cut a tooth! I trust he will now be soon better.
